message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.RO, cs.GR, cs.MM

This paper deals with the problem of missing marker reconstruction in human motion capture, which involves computer vision, machine learning, and robotics. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper proposes a neural network approach to learn the temporal and spatial correlation of human motion, which falls under the category of machine learning, specifically deep learning. Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely category. The paper also mentions the application of motion capture in robotics, which suggests that it could be categorized under cs.RO (Robotics). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of motion capture in movie production, which could fall under cs.GR (Graphics). Finally, the paper involves the use of cameras to triangulate the position of optical markers, which could be categorized under cs.MM (Multimedia).
